string.name: User Name
string.description: This name will appear in network browsers for this device.

string.name: User Description
string.description: This description will appear in network browsers for this device.

segment.name: Current Time, Date, and Clock State Refresh or Set
segment.description:
The settings in this section are not persistent between power cycles! This section can be used for two puposes:
1. Obtain (Read or Refresh) the current time, date, and clock state. 2. Configure/Set (Write) the current time, date, and clock state.
Changes to these configurations take effect immediately.

string.name: Date
string.description: Current date in format of "Mmm dd, yyyy".

string.name: Rate
string.description: Current clock rate in resolution of 0.25. Valid range: -512.00 to 511.75.

int.name: Reset Time
int.description: Reset the time to the "Initial Time Settings".

segment.name: Persistent Settings
segment.description: The settings in this section are persistent between power cycles. Depending on the kind of configuration change(s), the clock may automatically reboot in order to make the change(s) effective.

int.name: Operating Mode
int.description: There can only be one Master (generator) per Clock ID.

int.name: Tick Colon Flashing
int.description: When Enabled, the colon will flash when the clock is running.

group.name: Initial Time Settings
group.description: These are the initial time settings of the clock whenever it is powered on. These settings are only used when the Operating Mode is "Master (generator)".

int.name: Power-on Running State
int.description: The running state when the clock is powered on. This setting only applies when the Operating Mode is "Master (generator)".

string.name: Date
string.description: Initial date in format of "Mmm dd, yyyy".

string.name: Rate
string.description: Initial clock rate in resolution of 0.25. Valid range: -512.00 to 511.75.

int.name: Display Brightness Mode
int.description: In "Automatic" mode, the display brightness will determined by the following hour and minute settings.

int.name: Clock ID
int.description: The Clock ID used by this clock. Most users do not need to edit this field. The LCC standard defines four "well-known" clock ID's. It is also possible to specify a custom clock ID. If choosing option "Custom Self", this clock's own Unique ID will be used. If choosing "Custom User", the user can specify any ID of their choosing which is under their own control.

eventid.name: Custom Clock ID Event Base
eventid.description: 48-bit Unique ID, right padded with "00.00". Normally, the chosen clocks's 48-bit ID is automatically filled in. When Choosing "Custom User", a custom 48-bit ID, right padded with "00.00", may be filled in.
